channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Virgin Australia has told staff its subsidiary Tigerair will remain part of its low-fares offering once the troubled company emerges from voluntary administration.
item.title: Tigerair to remain an essential part of Virgin Australia's future, staff told

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australia records lowest COVID-19 case numbers in 24 hours since early March, Ruby Princess scheduled to depart Port Kembla on Thursday as nation's death toll stands at 74

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Police decided to enter the Labrador unit about six hours into the siege, only to find it empty.
item.title: Axe-wielding man escapes from police after Gold Coast unit siege

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: The Morrison government wants fresh ideas around tax and IR rather than old debates as its post-virus business advisor backs targeted incentives.
item.title: Government looks for new tax ideas as business press for corporate cut

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Emergency services were called to the Eastern Freeway, near the Burke Road exit, after reports multiple vehicles including a police car and semi-trailer had collided about 5.40pm Wednesday.
item.title: Several people feared dead after crash on Eastern Freeway

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Thirty-three-year-old Michael Black is believed to have been stabbed in a common area of the prison.
item.title: Inmate dies after stabbing at Parklea Correctional Centre

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: The senior doctor on the cruise ship said it would be wrong to say nobody aboard was showing signs of coronavirus before passengers disembarked.
item.title: Ruby Princess health log updated after passengers disembarked

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: One of Australia’s biggest shopping centre landlords has threatened to take action against shop owners closing their doors to protect employees from the coronavirus.
item.title: Retail property giant threatens action against tenants who close doors

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: South Sydney coach Wayne Bennett has cancelled next week's sessions, with the NRL considering sending spies into each club to monitor activity.
item.title: NRL planning to send spies to clubs as Bennett cancels sessions

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Former Essendon and Melbourne chief executive Peter Jackson gives his views in the latest in our series on what football should do in the new economic reality.
item.title: Footy re-set: Clubs don't need big homes, says Peter Jackson

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: A team could continue playing in quarantine hubs even if one of its players tests positive for COVID-19 under an early proposal related to testing outlined by the AFL to clubs on Tuesday.
item.title: AFL teams could play on in hubs even if player tests positive

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Dentists said the slight relaxing of restrictions means more patients will be able to get timely dental treatment.
item.title: Dentists ready to welcome patients back as restrictions ease from Monday

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Despite the small increase in cases, Deputy Chief Medical Officer Professor Paul Kelly said social distancing measures would remain in place until they were sure the trend continued.
item.title: Australia records four new cases as curve continues to flatten

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Surgeons will have to weigh up multiple factors in deciding which patients to book in for surgery in the coming weeks.
item.title: 'Tough decisions': Old and sick patients may be last in line for elective surgery

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: The letter criticising the RA administration, signed by 11 former Australia skippers, is long on complaint and short on solutions.
item.title: Little logic in big statement from Wallabies captains bashing Rugby Australia

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The expert is expected to go through the 13 critical fibres found in Bradley Edwards' old work car after it was seized from its new owner in late 2016.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: ChemCentre expert details clues found in accused's old work car 20 years after murders

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The Morrison government will not intervene in state bidding wars to rescue Virgin Australia as the troubled airline fields bids from investors and governments.
item.title: Federal government will let states outbid each other to help Virgin

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The mother of the dead man described the former law student as "charismatic, stunning, stylish, witty and irreverent".
item.title: Woman in custody after fatal Gold Coast street stabbing

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: The state continues to flatten its coronavirus infection curve, with authorities hailing the effect of strict social distancing rules.
item.title: Victoria records no net increase in COVID-19 infections

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The state government has warned people run the risk of being fined by police if they travel to a national park outside their area.
item.title: Open parks for far-flung hiking to ease city clusters, expert says

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Public and private patients waiting for elective surgeries in Victoria will be treated equally for the next six months, joining the same waiting list that prioritises urgent procedures.
item.title: Public, private elective surgery patients to be treated equally

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Carol Clay, who went missing with Russell Clay while on a camping trip in Victoria's high country, settled on a property in Melbourne's south-east a week before the pair disappeared.
item.title: Grandmother missing with man bought new home days before camping trip

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Family of Gill Rayson, who died in isolation ward awaiting coronavirus test say they're grateful experience wasn't 'in vain' after hospital implements changes.
item.title: Hospital apologises over death of cancer patient in COVID-19 isolation

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: Australia's biggest music stars, including Missy Higgins, Birds of Tokyo and Paul Kelly, will perform for the televised gig.
item.title: Tame Impala, Jimmy Barnes to lead star-studded Anzac Day tribute concert

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison needs to call out those targeting Chinese-Australians.
item.title: Chinese-Australians played a crucial role in fight against COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The venue hosted its only AFL premiership game in the Giants' first year in 2012.
item.title: Blacktown could host AFL games under joint Giants-Swans proposal

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: As public schools begin to gradually re-open, with pupils to attend one day a week, many private schools are still deciding their strategy.
item.title: NSW schools secure a year's supply of hand sanitiser and 10,000 thermometers

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: Two families who live next door to each other have put in a transparent fence panel so they can socialise at a distance from their respective backyards.
item.title: See-through fences help great neighbours remain good friends

item.description: Bombasay, a gelded son of Rothesay out of Last Tycoon mare Bomba and trained by Kris Lees, lines up for only his eighth start in a wide-open BM 70 over 1200m.
item.title: Boom time: Bombasay primed to blow away rivals at Newcastle

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card at Newcastle.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Newcastle on Thursday

item.description: "I'm not a stripper, I'm a performer," declares Sidney Saayman in Burlesque Boys doco.
item.title: What's on TV: Thursday, April 30

item.description: This British wartime spin on the Who Do You Think You Are features has four prominent actors.
item.title: What's on TV: Wednesday, April 29

item.description: Steve McQueen changed the perception of masculinity on the cinema screen.
item.title: What's on TV: Tuesday, April 28

item.description: The paramilitary force said it used a Ghased, or "messenger" satellite carrier to put the device into space, a previously unheard-of system.
item.title: Revolutionary Guard launches Iran's first military satellite

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The department store has delayed the reopening of its stores by two-and-a-half weeks to May 11.
item.title: 'Extremely tough': Myer pushes back store reopenings to May

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: The High Court on Wednesday threw out an appeal by a company headed up by Pnina Feldman, the sister of former mining magnate Joseph Gutnick.
item.title: Gutnick clan loses High Court appeal over $1 mine deal

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Kain Smiljanic was on parole and wearing a GPS ankle bracelet when he fired shots into the family home of a criminal associate in Geelong.
item.title: Police track churchgoer to drive-by shooting via his GPS ankle bracelet, court hears

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: parliament sits to consider emergency laws

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: While scientists initially pointed to men’s generally poor track record taking care of themselves – smoking too much, not washing their hands – new theories are emerging.
item.title: Men are more likely to die from COVID-19 than women. Why?

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Analysts say the annuities specialist might be due for a capital raise after a sell-off in equities markets punched a hole in its assets under management.
item.title: Challenger reports hit to funds under management amid super sell-off

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Newmarch House residents make up over a 10th of the state's hospital-level patients.
item.title: Extra staff promised as elderly COVID-19 patients left waiting for care

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Malcolm Turnbull's publisher has sent legal warnings to scores of people within the federal government over the former PM's new memoir.
item.title: Turnbull's publisher settles with Morrison adviser as it continues copyright pursuit

item.description: "Hang in there you sweet massive lump," host Hamish Blake tells a massive Lego build.
item.title: What's on TV: Monday, April 27

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The NRL may have to delay its restart for a fortnight if the Warriors are not allowed to train together while in quarantine.
item.title: Warriors quarantine exemption to make or break May 28 restart

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: A veteran pigeon racer has called on Australian enthusiasts to pay tribute to our diggers by releasing their birds at dawn on Anzac Day.
item.title: Let them fly: Precious pigeons offer peaceful purpose this Anzac Day

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Rising infant formula sales in China and Australia have delivered a surge in revenue for the ASX-listed company.
item.title: A2 Milk sales soar as demand for infant formula jumps amid pandemic

item.description: China's state council approved a Hong Kong government shake-up on Wednesday at a time when Beijing is reaffirming its authority over the city, raising political tensions and risking a revival of anti-government protests after months of relative calm.
item.title: China stamps its authority on Hong Kong government spill

item.dc:creator: Madeleine Heffernan
item.description: Private schools are seeking a taxpayer bailout to stave off large job cuts amid fears students will desert non-government schools as the country enters a recession.
item.title: Private schools seek taxpayer bailout to stave off job cuts

item.description: The Premier League clubs were scheduled to meet A-League side Brisbane Roar, coached by Robbie Fowler, in the inaugural Queensland Champions Cup.
item.title: West Ham, Crystal Palace postpone Australia tour
